content

Class Row

  • java.lang.Object
    • content.Row

  • public class Row
extends java.lang.Object
    A row is a container of cells. It is part of a table. A row should not be created outside its parent table. If it were, it would be ignored.
    Author:
    Bruno Quercia

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Row(Table table)
      Creates a new row with a parent table
      Row(Table table, int nbCells)
      Creates a new row with a parent table and a given number of cells

    • Method Detail

      • addCell

        public void addCell(int position)
        Adds a cell at a given position in the row. If this operation makes the row bigger than the other ones of its table, then all others will append cells to compensate.
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the new cell within the row

      • findPosition

        public Cell findPosition(int position)
        Fetches the cell that starts at a given position or the first to start after this position if no cell starts there.
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the cell within the line
        Returns:

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        the spatial size of the row.

      • getSuccessor

        public Row getSuccessor()
        Returns:
        the next row in the table, or null if it is last.

      • getCells

        public java.util.LinkedList<Cell> getCells()
        Returns:
        all the cells that occupy this row

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition(Cell cell)
        Parameters:
        cell - the cell we want to know the position of
        Returns:
        the spatial position of the cell

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Cell cell)
        Parameters:
        cell - the cell we want to find
        Returns:
        true if and only if the cell occupies this row

      • getNumber

        public int getNumber()
        Returns:
        the index within the table

      • getPredecessor

        public Row getPredecessor()
        Returns:
        the previous row within the table, or null if first row

      • getOwnCells

        public java.util.LinkedList<Cell> getOwnCells()
        Returns:
        the cells that start at this row (not the cells that occupy it)
